body:
So apparently `relaysEnabled` was deprecated, but it's still present in the XML config (lacks `,omitempty` tag). However, what is the intention for how the user should disable relaying? By changing the `default` listen address to `tcp://0.0.0.0:22000`? That's hardly discoverable :(

The config upgrade code must also take this into account, whatever we do here, so that the existing preference is retained.

To me, it seems like the simplest and cleanest solution is to resurrect the `relaysEnabled` option, and just have `default` not mean relays in that case. In fact, I'll prepare a PR for that for discussion, and if some better idea comes up in the meantime we can do that instead. :)
The upgrade code does take that into account afaik
The upgrade code is a bit weird, I think it assumes you're upgrading from a previous beta. It looks for the dynamic+https stuff in listen addresses, which we didn't have in v0.12

We had it in the relay addresses, both relay:// and dynamic... The refactor just consolidated the two address fields which honestly mean the same thing. If the problem is the obscurity involved disabling, then let's remove the "default" bit.
Just because noe adding a relay into listen addresses and unchecking relays enabled, it will still connect.

Yeah, and that's crap. The downside with just having it in the text box directly is that once removed it's a weird string that must be added back to enable it again, but that could conceivably be taken from another box or a default config (ugh...)...

Another issue I see is that even when removing the relay listen address, I might still connect to other devices using the relay. What if I _really don't want to use relays_?
Or change it into default and default-relays
Frankly, I think explicit is better here. We can add it into the help or something...

body: Maybe we should have a separate config entry called blacklistedDialers for disabling dialing?
Or, reviving your idea from above, replacing the magic device address `dynamic` address with `dynamic-local-tcp, dynamic-global-tcp, dynamic-relays` ... Also ugly as hell though

Or just checkboxes per device, implementing the blacklistedDialers.

```
[X] Use TCP
[ ] Use relays
```

Unchecking both disables the device...

So I don't think anyone will ever need that level of control. Ghrr, all options so far feel like shit.

Maybe we add relaysEnabled back, and then return ErrDisabled which is handled gracefully from both dialer and listener and bring back "default" ?
I think there is value in "default" as deploying utp or whatever will have bigger adoption straight away.
That's true. In that case my first PR is quite close to the truth, except it doesn't handle dialers yet.
